I want the new https://fediverse.info/explore/people People Directory to be easier to browse, so when you search or click on a topic that isn't popular you'll see a red X that you can click to remove.

Now I'm thinking about adding advanced filtering so you can hide results based on topics, domains and usernames.

Also considering adding Lists support so you can build and curate lists of accounts that are easily shareable.

Imma ship this before I get too carried away 😅 #fediverseInfo #peopleDirectory

30 years ago, one decision altered the course of our connected world

On April 30, 1993, the World Wide Web was released into the public domain. It revolutionized the internet and allowed users to create websites filled with graphics, audio and hyperlinks.

title: The 19th Century Woman Who Predicted Global Warming

last_post.content:
An appreciation of Eunice Foote, the suffragist and scientist who — way back in 1856 — conducted the first known experiment to demonstrate that CO2 was a heat-trapping gas …

…. and who, when writing up a paper of her findings, theorized that if the Earth’s atmosphere accumulated lots of CO2, the planet would warm up also

Alas, her work was lost to history until quite recently: https://clivethompson.medium.com/the-19th-century-woman-who-predicted-global-warming-af93f6b473ce

A “friend” link in case you’re not a Medium subscriber: https://clivethompson.medium.com/the-19th-century-woman-who-predicted-global-warming-af93f6b473ce?sk=2132215cf9d7a17c2f7d1e43d0ffd7af

So, here is what I'm trying to do to #BuildTheSocialWeb.

1. Servicing the issue queue for ActivityPub and Activity Stream 2.0 on GitHub on a bi-weekly basis, moving to weekly.

2. Documenting patterns in the Activity Streams 2.0 primer, and hopefully doing the same for ActivityPub.

3. Sharing architectural essays on my blog. I've got two lines up: end-to-end encryption and account portability.

4. Building https://cosocial.ca/ .

5. Expressing myself here. Bringing people here.

I came across a neat browser extension today. It looks for "rel=me" links pointing to mastodon profiles, and puts it in a little list for you to review.

In other words, you visit a website, and if tells you if there are any mastodon accounts associated to the website.

http://streetpass.social

Oh nice. Seattle Public Library has created a membership type for "13 to 26 year olds anywhere in the US" to be able to sign out e and audiobooks as a response to those locales banning books...

https://www.spl.org/programs-and-services/teens/books-unbanned

"Read the books they don't want you to. That's where the good stuff is." - LeVar Burton

title: People Can't Believe This Photo of a Bird Isn't Photoshopped or AI-Generated

last_post.content:
New dress controversy. Is the water blue or gold?

Not photoshop. Not AI.

https://mymodernmet.com/kenichi-ohno-bird-photo-illusion/

"So what is happening behind the egret that is causing the illusion? In the upper right-hand corner, there is a cream-colored wall. What we see below the wall is its reflection in the water and the position of the photographer has allowed for a perfectly straight “cut” in the composition, so one side is all water and the other side is the wall and its reflection."

Photo by Kenichi Ohno

People are calling today the 30th birthday of the web; more accurately it’s the 30th birthday of CERN releasing the source code. I vividly remember websites being a curiosity among FTP servers, Usenet newsgroups, and gopher holes.

Here’s to this marvelous technology, Earth’s biggest Choose Your Own Adventure book, one of the most backwardly compatible systems ever built. Modern browsers may be elaborate interpreter-compilers but they still render the first site: http://info.cern.ch/hypertext/WWW/TheProject.html

@law #lawfedi

In the same vein, if you're on a general-purpose #Mastodon #instance and you are a legal professional with any interest in joining a topic-driven alternative, I humbly suggest https://esq.social

I'm the admin there too. I have help with mod stuff, @jacobschumer is probably busy with Jedi Survivor at the moment but he’ll emerge at some point and be there to shoot down trolls and such as well.

title: Bluesky’s CEO on competing with Twitter and Mastodon

last_post.content:
(For two years, Jay Graber gave no interviews to the public. Zero transparency. So much for Dorsey's "out in the open" promises.)

During that time, Dorsey privately (later, publicly) lobbied for Musk, "the singular solution I trust" to take over Twitter.

Dorsey helped fund Musk's takeover to the tune of $1 billion, making him one of Musk's top backers (after Qatar).

"Musk reportedly ended the company’s ties with #Bluesky [sometime after] he took over Twitter."

https://www.theverge.com/23686778/bluesky-ceo-jay-graber-interview-decentralized-social-media-twitter-mastodon

Here's my prediction.

With ActivityPub, Mastodon will soon find a challenger that starts getting more attention.

Maybe is will be the *key apps. Maybe it will be Barcelona. Maybe it will be WordPress.

But when this starts happening, this will shake up the community-at-large -- and completely change the direction of the protocol.

title: Algorithmen & Zeichen. Beiträge von Frieder Nake zur Gegenwart des Computers

last_post.content:
The book »Algorithmen & Zeichen« with essays from Frieder Nake is now available as open access! The book was edited by Jan Distelmeyer, Sophie Ehrmanntraut and myself. It contains 18 texts (15 on German, 3 on English) from Frieder Nake — as well as an excerpt of his artistic work.

If you are into media theory, computer science, computer art and / or UX design: this book might be something for you!

https://www.mediarep.org/handle/doc/20565

title: SFWA’s Inaugural Infinity Award Honoree Is Octavia E. Butler

last_post.content:
SFWA has created a new award: the Infinity Award. SFWA’s Grand Master Award can only be given to a living person, so the Infinity is the corresponding award for people who’ve died.

The first Infinity Award recipient is Octavia E. Butler.

https://file770.com/sfwas-inaugural-infinity-award-honoree-is-octavia-e-butler/

Missed the exciting news that the boffins at NASA JPL have figured out a way to use reserve power to keep using all the scientific instruments on board Voyager 2 for even longer. For a mission that only had a requirement to last until about 1982, job well done. https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasas-voyager-will-do-more-science-with-new-power-strategy

Several years ago, I wrote extensively about space probes, including *six* articles about or involving the Voyager probes! https://glog.glennf.com/blog/2017/8/4/if-you-love-voyager-like-i-love-voyager

Good day Mastodon! Here is my third and last (hopefully friendly) reminder about my online survey.

I am writing to kindly remind you about the online survey I launched a few weeks ago as part of my #PhD in #digitalhumanities, aiming to understand the main practices and activities of the individuals involved in the International Image Interoperability Framework (#IIIF) and/or the #LinkedArt communities.

If you haven't had a chance to fill in the survey yet, I would greatly appreciate your help in taking 10 to 20 minutes of your time to share your insights with me. Your participation would be invaluable to my research.

https://forms.gle/Djvuf7HrrFqxXFxd8 (closing on Sunday, 7 May)

Many thanks! :)

@IIIF@glammr.us @iiif@a.gup.pe #culturalheritage #sts @digitalhumanities

title: Recent, rapid ocean warming ahead of El Niño alarms scientists

last_post.content:
Let’s not forget that, while a mainstay of climate disaster movies, the “plucky scientist that yells at the politicians” character is also a fiction.

From the article:

Several scientists contacted for this story were reluctant to go on the record about the implications.

One spoke of being "extremely worried and completely stressed."

https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-65339934

Living+ is real. It’s called Storyliving by Disney. #Succession https://www.storylivingbydisney.com/

This article on the interplay between English and German in Berlin, including the oft-maligned Denglisch, original German Anglicisms like “Handy”, English words whose meaning has slipped like “actual” for “current”, and the question of how to adapt English loanwords to German grammar (i.e.,“gedownloadet” vs. “downgeloadet”), is comprehensive and worth a read: https://europeanreviewofbooks.com/beamer-dressman-bodybag/en

Tangentially, I have found that some of the observations also apply to English as used in Sweden.

@healthstatsdude @ct_bergstrom @knewman
I'll give a shameless plus for #ggdist, which makes it easy to create a bunch of visualizations of distributions, including density plots, dotplots, and beeswarms: https://mjskay.github.io/ggdist/

One big difference compared to ggbeeswarm is that ggdist will automatically set the dot size to ensure the chart does not overrun the display area

title: Large Language Models are Versatile Decomposers: Decompose Evidence and Questions for Table-based Reasoning

last_post.content:
Large Language Models are Versatile Decomposers for Table-based Reasoning

Surpasses the human performance on Tabfact for the first time by decomposing a large table and leveraging SQL execution to mitigate the hallucination of CoT.

https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13808

title: ongoing by Tim Bray · Amazon Q1 2023 Financials

title: Bridge to Obscurity by Bill Gallagher

last_post.content:
Bridge to Obscurity

This image was captured on a July afternoon when the marine layer inverted and pulled a big fog bank into the San Francisco Bay over the Golden Gate bridge.
The fog seems to swallow the bridge almost completely. Here you see the bridge as it disappears slowly into the fog looking as if it just ends in the middle of nowhere. See the Full image here: https://fineartamerica.com/featured/bridge-to-obscurity-bill-gallagher.html #BridgeToObscurity #BillGallagherPhotography #AYearForArt #GoldenGateBridge #Fog #Foggy #SanFrancisco

title: Computer Shopper February 1986 : Computer Shopper : Free Download, Borrow, and Streaming : Internet Archive

last_post.content:
I'm happy to announce the first of the Computer Shoppers has been scanned.

https://archive.org/details/computer-shopper-february-1986

This includes an Aesthetic and Readable version (aimed towards looking like the bleedthrough newsprint original, as well as one for better reading). Thanks to Gaming Alexandria for post-processing. The 70gb RAW scans will also be made available.

Tons of points were learned doing this, so expect the next ones to rock harder. Thanks, everyone who contributed to this project.

title: Opinion | Loneliness Is an Epidemic in America, Writes the Surgeon General

last_post.content:
At the onset of the pandemic, Dr. Murthy joined the entire Biden campaign staff to talk to us about loneliness and exhaustion. He advised us how to be present, even when we weren't physically present, and to focus on better, not more. His piece here rings powerfully back to that conversation.

"We need to acknowledge the loneliness and isolation that millions are experiencing and the grave consequences for our mental health, physical health and collective well-being."

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/30/opinion/loneliness-epidemic-america.html

Mastodon's official numbers have it growing around 200 accounts per hour, not the ~1300 shown lately by a bot we all enjoy.

So in April Mastodon added 40k MAU and 141k accounts.

Thank you to @tobiaalberti for keeping historical data on Mastodon's official statistics, at https://cryptpad.fr/sheet/#/2/sheet/view/8TmIxgfFMBQ9h4maRV79wdiEwlu-37v3gRfTKUFDwEM/

Thanks also to @hildabast for citing that data, and @laurenshof for citing Hilda's recent essay!

title: Keep Your Memories, Kill Your Nostalgia

last_post.content:
"I have killed my affection for Harry Potter. I have buried it. I am refusing to allow this series space in my life. Trans people are worth more than Rowling is. They are worth more than Rowling’s world. They are worth opening and suturing a wound, and moving past a children’s story. Real people are harmed by Rowling’s rhetoric, and giving her stories more space in our cultural consciousness is harmful to one of the most marginalized groups of people in the world."

https://gizmodo.com/harry-potter-rowling-terf-tv-series-hbo-max-nostalgia-1850363444

title: Takoma Park Man Arrested for Possession of Child Pornography

last_post.content:
Introducing you to Takoma Park, MD elementary school librarian Charles Sutherland, who took it upon himself to spray-paint GROOMER on two public libraries during Pride week - likely because the libraries held Pride events.

What did police find when they searched the home of Sutherland - a single man with no children, nieces, or nephews?
-diapers
-children's dolls
-a child-sized, life-like doll, in Sutherland's bed
-child porn on his laptop
News report:
https://www.sourceofthespring.com/takoma-park-news/2804290/takoma-park-man-arrested-for-possession-of-child-pornography/

The famous UK company Artic, amidst the mania for contest-games, made a ZX81 tape in 1982 consisting of 12 puzzles that needed to be solved to win 10,000 pounds. As far as my research has found nobody won the contest. Certainly nobody has written about the game at length. Can we solve it now?

Audience participation encouraged!

https://bluerenga.blog/2023/04/30/krakit-1982/

title: How Mark Zuckerberg broke Meta’s workforce

last_post.content:
Wall Street might be buying into what Zuckerberg is doing with Meta.

But inside Meta, it’s a different story. Morale is shot. Even at the executive level, people question Zuckerberg’s decisions.

This is one reason I question Barcelona’s ability to dominate the Fediverse. I don’t think Meta has any enthusiasm for a new project.

title: Senate GOP blocks Equal Rights Amendment

last_post.content:
It's telling that this was nowhere near front page news.

"Senate Republicans on Thursday blocked a measure that would have allowed the Equal Rights Amendment (ERA) to be added to the Constitution.

Senators voted 51 to 47 to invoke cloture on a motion to proceed, falling short of the 60 votes needed.
Sens. Lisa Murkowski (Alaska) and Susan Collins (Maine) were the lone Republicans to vote with every Democrat. “

New blog entry: Introducing RDF and related standards: the series. https://www.bobdc.com/blog/rdfintroseries/

/kbin is a Reddit alternative for the Fediverse!

That's right, it's ActivityPub-enabled.

Which means that it connects with Mastodon, Pixelfed, Calckey, Friendica -- 100+ platforms that use ActivityPub.

What are its features?

* upvotes and downvotes
* comments
* feeds for "Top", "Hot", and "Newest"

I think it's more functional and better looking than Reddit.

This might be more than a Reddit alternative. It could be a Reddit killer!

https://kbin.social

@fediversenews

title: Heat wave map: See where Americans face the most extreme heat risk

last_post.content:
This map gives "red states" a whole new meaning.

If you live in the US, you can type in your zip code and see an estimate of how many days per year will have a heat index of over 100 °F in 2053:

https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/interactive/2022/extreme-heat-risk-map-us/

The model used is explained here:

https://riskfactor.com/methodology/heat

The heat index, developed by the National Weather Service, takes humidity into account:

https://www.weather.gov/ama/heatindex

title: Tech Use, Depression in Older Adults

last_post.content:
"Researchers found that in-person interactions with friends, family, and health care providers were associated with fewer mental health concerns. title: Donald Trump Built a National Debt So Big (Even Before the Pandemic) That It’ll Weigh Down the Economy for Years

last_post.content:
Donald Trump Built a National Debt So Big (Even Before the Pandemic) That It’ll Weigh Down the Economy for Years

He promised to reduce the national debt but instead increased it. It is now at its highest level relative to the U.S. economy since the end of World War II

This is one of his lesser known but profoundly damaging legacies, the explosive rise in the national debt that occurred on his watch.

#usa #politics #debtceiling #gop

https://www.propublica.org/article/national-debt-trump
